com.gtnewhorizon.structurelib

Class StructureLibAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gtnewhorizon.structurelib.StructureLibAPI

  • public class StructureLibAPI
extends Object
    A stable interface into the structure lib's internals. Backwards compatibility is maintained to the maximum extend possible.

    • Method Detail

      • startHinting

        public static void startHinting(World w)
        Start a batch of hinting. All hints particles generated during one batch will be considered to belong to one hologram.

        You don't need to call this unless your constructable tool didn't call ConstructableUtility.handle(ItemStack, EntityPlayer, World, int, int, int, int)

      • endHinting

        public static void endHinting(World w)
        End current batch of hinting. All hints particles generated during one batch will be considered to belong to one hologram.

        You don't need to call this unless your constructable tool didn't call ConstructableUtility.handle(ItemStack, EntityPlayer, World, int, int, int, int)

      • hintParticleTinted

        public static void hintParticleTinted(World w,
                                      int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int z,
                                      IIcon[] icons,
                                      short[] RGBa)
        Generate a new hint particle on client side at given location using given textures with a tint.
        Parameters:
        w - World to spawn. Usually the client world.
        x - x coord
        y - y coord
        z - z coord
        icons - 6 texture. in forge direction order.
        RGBa - a 4 short array. tint in rgba form. currently alpha channel is ignored, but we might change this later on.

      • hintParticleTinted

        public static void hintParticleTinted(World w,
                                      int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int z,
                                      Block block,
                                      int meta,
                                      short[] RGBa)
        Generate a new hint particle on client side at given location using textures from given block with a tint.
        Parameters:
        w - World to spawn. Usually the client world.
        x - x coord
        y - y coord
        z - z coord
        block - block to take texture from
        meta - the meta of block to take texture from
        RGBa - a 4 short array. tint in rgba form. currently alpha channel is ignored, but we might change this later on.

      • hintParticle

        public static void hintParticle(World w,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                int z,
                                IIcon[] icons)
        Generate a new hint particle on client side at given location using given textures.
        Parameters:
        w - World to spawn. Usually the client world.
        x - x coord
        y - y coord
        z - z coord
        icons - 6 texture. in forge direction order.

      • hintParticle

        public static void hintParticle(World w,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                int z,
                                Block block,
                                int meta)
        Generate a new hint particle on client side at given location using textures from given block.
        Parameters:
        w - World to spawn. Usually the client world.
        x - x coord
        y - y coord
        z - z coord
        block - block to take texture from
        meta - the meta of block to take texture from

      • markHintParticleError

        public static boolean markHintParticleError(EntityPlayer player,
                                            World w,
                                            int x,
                                            int y,
                                            int z)
        Update the tint of given hint particle. Do nothing if particle not found. Can be called on either client side or server side. Server side will schedule a network message to update it for this player only. Will do nothing if no hint particle is found at given location.
        Returns:
        false if nothing updated. true if updated or update instruction sent.

      • updateHintParticleTint

        public static boolean updateHintParticleTint(EntityPlayer player,
                                             World w,
                                             int x,
                                             int y,
                                             int z,
                                             short[] RGBa)
        Update the tint of given hint particle. Do nothing if particle not found.
        Returns:
        false if nothing updated. true if updated.

      • queryAlignment

        public static void queryAlignment(IAlignmentProvider provider)
        Query the ExtendedFacing of this tile entity from client side. Can be sent only on client side. The ExtendedFacing will later be set onto given tile entity via IAlignment.setExtendedFacing(ExtendedFacing) upon arrival of server reply.

        The server side will query the ExtendedFacing of this provider using IAlignment.getExtendedFacing()

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if is not tile entity or provided a null alignment

      • sendAlignment

        public static void sendAlignment(IAlignmentProvider provider)
        Send the ExtendedFacing of this Tile Entity to all players. Can be called on server side only.

        The receiving tile entity will receive the ExtendedFacing via its IAlignment.setExtendedFacing(ExtendedFacing) method.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if is not tile entity or provided a null alignment

      • sendAlignment

        public static void sendAlignment(IAlignmentProvider provider,
                                 EntityPlayerMP player)
        Send the ExtendedFacing of this Tile Entity to given player. Can be called on server side only.

        The receiving tile entity will receive the ExtendedFacing via its IAlignment.setExtendedFacing(ExtendedFacing) method.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if is not tile entity or provided a null alignment

      • sendAlignment

        public static void sendAlignment(IAlignmentProvider provider,
                                 NetworkRegistry.TargetPoint targetPoint)
        Send the ExtendedFacing of this Tile Entity to all players around target point. Can be called on server side only.

        The receiving tile entity will receive the ExtendedFacing via its IAlignment.setExtendedFacing(ExtendedFacing) method.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if is not tile entity or provided a null alignment

      • sendAlignment

        public static void sendAlignment(IAlignmentProvider provider,
                                 World dimension)
        Send the ExtendedFacing of this Tile Entity to all players in that dimension. Can be called on server side only.

        The receiving tile entity will receive the ExtendedFacing via its IAlignment.setExtendedFacing(ExtendedFacing) method.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if is not tile entity or provided a null alignment

      • getBlockHint

        public static Block getBlockHint()
        Get the Block for StructureLib supplied hint block.

      • getItemBlockHint

        public static Item getItemBlockHint()
        Get the ItemBlock for StructureLib supplied hint block.

      • isDebugEnabled

        public static boolean isDebugEnabled()
        Check if structure debug mode is on.
        Returns:
        true if debug mode is on

      • setDebugEnabled

        public static void setDebugEnabled(boolean enabled)

      • isBlockTriviallyReplaceable

        public static boolean isBlockTriviallyReplaceable(World w,
                                                  int x,
                                                  int y,
                                                  int z,
                                                  EntityPlayerMP actor)
        Determines if given block can be replaced without much effort. The exact predicate clauses is not stable and will be changed, but the general idea will always stay the same.

        Use this in your IStructureElement.survivalPlaceBlock(Object, World, int, int, int, ItemStack, IItemSource, EntityPlayerMP, java.util.function.Consumer)
